title: Three.js port parity
description: Ongoing context log for Three.js port toward full Godot parity.

comments.author: talves
comments.text: Initialized Rapier physics in web port; added physics stepping in Engine; added static trimesh collisions for fortress/village/hills and ground collider; added FBX/OBJ loading for village/mountain with SkeletonUtils cloning; added arrow physics bodies w/ CCD + collision callbacks; wired animation mixers for player/remote/entity with basic state->clip mapping; copied village/mountain assets into public/assets.

comments.author: talves
comments.text: Added Godot Transform3D -> Three.js helper and instantiated all three hills with matching transforms from lands_of_balance.tscn; each hill now added to scene and registered for trimesh collision via Rapier.

comments.author: talves
comments.text: Inspected GLB animations: paladin has only 'mixamo.com', archer has only 'Take 001', bobba has no animations, dragon has multiple 'Dragon_Ancient_*' clips. Attempted npm run dev but Vite failed to bind ::1:3000 (EPERM). Added Rapier kinematic colliders for entities and arrow->entity damage reporting; updated dragon anim mapping to actual clip names; entity colliders now follow network positions.
